result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric F Pavloski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
*Pay restitution to Club Forest Bar and Golden Sands Speedway
*Pay a minimum of $200 per month towards the restitution

*Pay costs
*If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

*Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
*If have a valid prescription, use as directed by the doctor.

*Continue with AODA counseling in the Wood County Drug Court until discharged, and then continue thereafter with any continuing recommendations.
*No contact with Club Forest Bar or Golden Sands Speedway.  Do not go upon their premises or have any direct/indirect contact with the businesses.
*Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.
*In the event Defendant complies with probation, the Court will order Defendant is eligible for expungement.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Eric F Pavloski in court with attorney Anne Renc. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

10:20 AM Court calls case.
Court states appearances.

State has filed an amended information.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

There is an agreement.
Count 1 is being amended.
Defendant is pleading to Count 1. Counts 2-4 will be dismissed and read in

Atty Cousins presents a restitution summary to the Court.
Atty Cousins states the plea agreement.

Atty Renc concurs.

Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST to amended Count 1.

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Renc for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Amended Count 1: Found Guilty
Count 2 through 4: Dismissed and Read In

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court, this is a joint recommendation.
State has submitted a victim impact statement with the Court.
Atty Renc makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant addresses the Court prior to sentencing.

Court addresses the parties, accepts the joint recommendation.

BY THE COURT:
Amended Count 1:
Sentence is Withheld
Probation for a period of 36 Months
Conditions:
Continue with AODA counseling in the Wood County Drug Court until discharged, and then continue thereafter with any continuing recommendations
Pay costs
Pay restitution in the amount of $3,079.69. Pay a minimum of $200 per month towards the restitution
No contact with Club Forest Bar or Golden Sands Speedway. Do not go upon their premises or have any direct/indirect contact with the businesses
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. If have a valid prescription, use as directed by the doctor
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances
In the event Defendant complies with probation, the Court will order Defendant is eligible for expungement

Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 09:30 am.
